snippet: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ruled that the 2011 settlement of the tenants’ class-action lawsuit against the Pinnacle Group was “fair, reasonable and adequate.”
abstract: Federal appeals court upholds 2011 settlement affecting more than 20,000 rent-regulated tenants in New York City; decision clears way for them to seek individual compensation from their landlord Pinnacle Group for rent overcharges and other complaints.
lead_paragraph: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ruled that the 2011 settlement of the tenants’ class-action lawsuit against the Pinnacle Group was “fair, reasonable and adequate.”

headline.main: Court Upholds a Settlement Affecting 20,000 City Renters
headline.print_headline: Court Upholds a Settlement Affecting 20,000 City Renters
